In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

In Julia, you can use the `split` method to break down the string into words, then count how many characters are in the current line. When this goes over your desired width, start a new line. Here is a function that accomplishes this:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::AbstractString; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s)
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            println(line)
            line = ""
        end
        line *= word * " "
    end
    println(line) # print the last line after loop terminates
end
```

Now, let's test this function with an example:

```julia
wrap_string("This is a simple test string that will be broken into lines of at most 10 characters each.")
```

This would output something like:

```shell
"This is a "
"simple test "
"string that "
"will be "
"broken "
"into lines "
"of at most 10 "
"characters each."
```
